alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Lincoln; Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 23 at 2:52PM CDT until August 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THURSDAY EVENING FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS NEAR AND SOUTH OF THE I-20 CORRIDOR OF EAST TEXAS, NORTHERN AND CENTRAL LOUISIANA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR ALL OF NORTHERN LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREA...All fire districts in Northern Louisiana. * TIMING...Through 8 PM CDT Thursday evening. * WINDS...Northeast 5 to 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 30 to 35 percent. * TEMPERATURES...From to 105 to 109. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition and spread of wildfires is possible due to persistent hot and dry conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
